body:
plant sequences are published via GenBank with release notes at:

https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/gbrel.txt

and plant sequence naming convention - 

https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/gbpln[0-9]+.seq.gz

for instance 

```bash
curl "https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/gbpln1.seq.gz"\
 | gunzip\
 | head -n100
```

yielded - 

```
GBPLN1.SEQ          Genetic Sequence Data Bank
                           April 15 2023

                NCBI-GenBank Flat File Release 255.0

                         Plant Sequences (Part 1)

  135615 loci,   171563507 bases, from   135615 reported sequences


LOCUS       AB000001                 660 bp    DNA     linear   PLN 15-JUL-2009
DEFINITION  Rhizoctonia solani genes for 18S rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, 28S rRNA, partial
            and complete sequence, isolate: #1.
ACCESSION   AB000001
VERSION     AB000001.1
KEYWORDS    .

ORIGIN

       61 tctttcatcc catacacacc tgtgaacttg tgagacagat ggggaattta tttattgttt

      541 actgtaaaaa ggtggccaag gtaaatgcag atgaaccgct tctaatagtc cattgacttg
      601 gacaatattt ttatgatctg atctcaaatc aggtaggact acccgctgaa cttaagcata

With GenBank using partitioning their holdings in the following resource categories - 

Note that the number in front of the category (or divisions) indicates the number of resource files (or sequence data files). One resource file (sequence data file) contain many accessions.

```bash
 curl --silent "https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/gbrel.txt"\
 | grep -oE "gb[a-z]+[0-9]+[.]seq"\
 | sed 's/^gb//g'\
 | grep -oE "^[a-z]+"\
 | sort\
 | uniq -c\
 | sort -nr
```

```
   2379 inv
   2113 pln
   1874 bct
   1772 vrl
   1156 est
    714 vrt
    600 rod
    540 gss
    504 pat
    470 con
    332 mam
    254 tsa
    164 htg
    154 env
    114 pri
     58 syn
     22 sts
     16 htc
     12 phg
      2 una
```

For this issue, we'd need the pln (or plant) resources.

with 
```
PRI - primate sequences
ROD - rodent sequences
MAM - other mammalian sequences
VRT - other vertebrate sequences
INV - invertebrate sequences
PLN - plant, fungal, and algal sequences
BCT - bacterial sequences
VRL - viral sequences
PHG - bacteriophage sequences
SYN - synthetic sequences
UNA - unannotated sequences
EST - EST sequences (Expressed Sequence Tags) 
PAT - patent sequences
STS - STS sequences (Sequence Tagged Sites) 
GSS - GSS sequences (Genome Survey Sequences) 
HTG - HTGS sequences (High Throughput Genomic sequences) 
HTC - HTC sequences (High Throughput cDNA sequences) 
ENV - Environmental sampling sequences
CON - Constructed sequences
TSA - Transcriptome Shotgun Assembly sequences
```

Yost's affiliations include California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo with gbif publisher id https://www.gbif.org/publisher/d16f32bb-204f-4c07-95eb-6673e90225e9 . 

![image](https://github.com/globalbioticinteractions/globalbioticinteractions/assets/1084872/2daeabd5-0e26-41d3-b163-a1b15fe14ea8)

preliminary integration script to help find and link sequences from OBI collection:

track OBI DwC-A

```
preston track https://api.gbif.org/v1/dataset/f56df26e-73f5-4d37-bfed-3d46c0834e82
```

and select associatedSequences using

```bash
preston ls\
 | preston dwc-stream\
 | jq 'select(.["http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/associatedSequences"] != null)' 
```

to yield two records with associatedSequences values.

Including values:

```
  "http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/associatedSequences": "Test, Test, URL test",
```

 and 

```
  "http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/associatedSequences": "Abronia pogonantha",
```
Next step is to list all GenBank plant sequences, and somehow filter out all OBI related references.

In reviewing the structure of the OBI catalog number, it appears their naming convention is structured like:


```regex
OBI[0-9]+
```

which means: starts with ```OBI``` followed by some sequence of numbers. 

```bash
preston ls\
 | preston dwc-stream\
 | jq --raw-output 'select(.["http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/catalogNumber"] != null)'\
 | jq -c .\
 | grep -vE "OBI[0-9]+"\
 | jq .
```
 
with only 8 out of 84k specimen records *not* having this pattern (exclude those without a catalog number all together. 

[OBI-unconventional-catalog-numbers.json.txt](https://github.com/globalbioticinteractions/globalbioticinteractions/files/11822062/OBI-unconventional-catalog-numbers.json.txt)

including catalog number w/ references:

| catalogNumber | reference |
| --- | --- |
| 49981 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=174132 |
| 153584 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=174939 |
| 172294 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=180815 |
| 123456 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=4622930 |
| 002 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=5305276 |
| 34.027985, -119.548722 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=5545590 |
| OBi183980 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=5784309 |
| 5546896 | https://cch2.org/portal/collections/individual/index.php?occid=5804151 |

in 

> Shobha Sharma and others, The NCBI BioCollections Database, Database, Volume 2018, 2018, bay006, https://doi.org/10.1093/database/bay006

they indicated that ```specimen_voucher```  source feature is used to capture the reference to some voucher specimen.

![image](https://github.com/globalbioticinteractions/globalbioticinteractions/assets/1084872/f0cabef8-c85a-495d-b59c-47bec0168e54)

In scanning 2 billions lines in genbank plant sequence records using:

```
preston ls | grep hasVersion | grep gz | preston cat | gunzip | pv -l | grep "specimen_voucher" | sed 's/.*specimen_voucher//g' | sed 's/^=\"//g' | sed 's/\"$//g' | tee voucher-reference.txt | grep OBI | tee obi-couter-references.txt
```

I was able to find the following specimen voucher references:

```

25383 (OBI)
25383 (OBI)
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
OBI
```

To help track ncbi's genbank plant resources, I've created - 

https://github.com/jhpoelen/gbpln

And, once a first tracking session is completed . . . we can use Preston's newly introduced ```gb-stream``` command to stream flat files from the tracked genbank release files.

https://github.com/bio-guoda/preston/issues/246

In working towards linking GenBank accession records to their associated specimen in Yost's collection at OBI, I did the following:

1. tracked all genbank flat file releases for plants, fungi, and algae (see https://github.com/jhpoelen/gbpln) took about 12 hours to generate preston archive with signature hash://sha256/efa589e9927c8c10ac81867220982a3eb732c322ddebca6db2a9147578218ff5 and associated data archive volume of 221G)
2. used newly introduced `preston gn-stream` to extract json summaries of these gb flat files (444MB gzipped)
3. list all flat files json summaries that mention "OBI" using:
```bash
preston ls --anchor hash://sha256/efa589e9927c8c10ac81867220982a3eb732c322ddebca6db2a9147578218ff5\
 | preston gb-stream\
 |  grep -E '[^A-Za-z]OBI[^A-Za-z]'`
```
4. upload the list of flat files summaries and attach below.

 
[obj.json.txt](https://github.com/globalbioticinteractions/globalbioticinteractions/files/11897856/obj.json.txt)

with 256 hits, out of 14M (14319581) total accession records. 

```
cat obi.json | wc -l
444
```

then, extracting a table with genbank accession candidates with references to OBI specimen. 

```
cat obi.json\
 | jq '{ "accession": .["accession"], "specimen_voucher": .["specimen_voucher"], "definition": .["definition"], "derived_from":  .["http://www.w3.org/ns/prov#wasDerivedFrom"] }'\
 | mlr --ijsonl --otsv cat\
 | sed 's+^+https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/+g'\
 | sed 's+line:+https://linker.bio/line:+g'\
 > genbank-accessions-with-possible-OBI-specimen.tsv
```
